definitions: Past tense of dope: to give a drug to (a person or animal), especially illicitly to enhance or detract from performance.
Past tense of dope: to treat or mix with a chemical substance.
Past tense of dope: to apply dope (a thick liquid preparation) to.
examples: The athlete was doped before the race.
The fabric was doped to make it waterproof.
He doped the wings of the model airplane.
